tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE supply_chain_water_usage (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    daily_usage DECIMAL(10,2),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE supply_chain (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    supplier VARCHAR(255),
    receiver VARCHAR(255),
    amount DECIMAL,
    date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE WaterConsumption (
  ID INT PRIMARY KEY,
  Location VARCHAR(255),
  Consumption DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE Supplier (
  SupplierID INT PRIMARY KEY,
  Name VARCHAR(255),
  Address VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE Delivery (
  DeliveryID INT PRIMARY KEY,
  SupplierID INT,
  Location VARCHAR(255),
  Quantity DECIMAL,
  Status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE WaterUsage (
    usage_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
    usage_amount INT NOT NULL,
    source_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (source_id) REFERENCES WaterSources(source_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SupplyChainOperations (
    operation_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    operation_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    operation_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    storage_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (storage_id) REFERENCES WaterStorage(storage_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterUsageLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_id INT NOT NULL,
    source_id INT NOT NULL,
    usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
    usage_volume DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE SupplierContracts (
    contract_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    supplier_id INT NOT NULL,
    source_id INT NOT NULL,
    contract_date DATE NOT NULL,
    contract_duration INT NOT NULL
);
